title: High Court judges have missed the point on older women's pensions - men already had it so much better
text:
Judges have ruffled feathers yet again. The High Court has delivered a devastating blow to all those who have campaigned against the increase in state pension age to 65. An attempt to create equality between men and women has left millions of women born in the Fifties in the lurch - and ill-prepared for retirement.

Two women from the Backto60 campaign group took the Government to a judicial review, arguing the delay in receiving their state pension had disproportionately affected them.

Until 2010, women received the state pension at 60, and it has been rising since then, eventually catching up with men. Now it is 66 for both sexes and will rise again, to 67, next year.

This week, two judges...
description: Judges have ruffled feathers yet again.
